headline: Markets Pull Back From Earlier Slump as Trump Announces Warsh to Head Fed. Stock Futures Still Falling.
summary: Stock futures were falling sharply to end another volatile week for markets after President Donald Trump announced Kevin Warsh as the new chair of the Federal Reserve.  The former Fed governor was the hot favorite to lead the central bank with betting markets quickly raising the likelihood that he will succeed Jerome Powell to around 85% from 30% late Thursday.  Investors widely expect him to implement Trump’s demands for lower rates and fears remain about Fed independence after the president’s repeated attacks on Powell, who called subpoenas issued to the central bank a political pretext.

Investors widely expect him to implement Trump’s demands for lower rates and fears remain about Fed independence after the president’s repeated attacks on Powell, who called subpoenas issued to the central bank a political pretext.

headline: None of Trump's Fed chair candidates 'fit the bill': Economist
summary: As the Trump administration continues to tease when it will announce the president's nominee to become the next chair of the Federal Reserve, Wolfe Research Chief Economist Stephanie Roth outlines who the top candidates are at this moment.Make sure to check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on each of the possible candidates to be the next Fed chair: former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett, Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Kevin Warsh, a former Fed 'hawk' now in tune with Trump
summary: Kevin Warsh, a former US Federal Reserve official tipped to be named its chief by President Donald Trump on Friday, was long an inflation foe but has aligned his views with those of Trump officials seeking aggressive interest rate cuts.In an interview with Fox Business at the time, he backed interest rate cuts to boost growth, even as Fed officials said they needed to evaluate the potential impact of Trump's tariffs barrage on inflation.

headline: Panama court voids CK Hutchison port contracts, clouding sales plan
summary: STORY: Future operations of the Panama Canal face fresh doubt after the country's Supreme Court annulled key port contracts held by a subsidiary of Hong Kong-based CK Hutchison.Thursday's decision leaves the future ownership of some Panama Canal facilities unclear.The country's highest court said that it found the laws and acts underpinning the concession contract between the state and Panama Ports Company unconstitutional.Panama Ports Company, a CK Hutchison subsidiary, operates container terminals at the canal's Pacific and Atlantic entrances, separate from the waterway's operations.It has held the contracts since the 1990s.The decision could disrupt CK Hutchison's proposed $23 billion sale of dozens of ports worldwide, including the Panamanian terminals, to a consortium led by BlackRock and Mediterranean Shipping Company.The three companies did not immediately respond to requests for comment.CK Hutchison's Hong Kong listed shares dropped around 5% Friday following the news. The ruling comes amid a growing U.S.-China rivalry over global trade routes and is seen as a win for Washington.President Donald Trump has pushed to curb Chinese influence over the Panama Canal, which carries about 5% of global maritime trade.

raw.headline: Panama court voids CK Hutchison port contracts, clouding sales plan
raw.summary: STORY: Future operations of the Panama Canal face fresh doubt after the country's Supreme Court annulled key port contracts held by a subsidiary of Hong Kong-based CK Hutchison.Thursday's decision leaves the future ownership of some Panama Canal facilities unclear.The country's highest court said that it found the laws and acts underpinning the concession contract between the state and Panama Ports Company unconstitutional.Panama Ports Company, a CK Hutchison subsidiary, operates container terminals at the canal's Pacific and Atlantic entrances, separate from the waterway's operations.It has held the contracts since the 1990s.The decision could disrupt CK Hutchison's proposed $23 billion sale of dozens of ports worldwide, including the Panamanian terminals, to a consortium led by BlackRock and Mediterranean Shipping Company.The three companies did not immediately respond to requests for comment.CK Hutchison's Hong Kong listed shares dropped around 5% Friday following the news. The ruling comes amid a growing U.S.-China rivalry over global trade routes and is seen as a win for Washington.President Donald Trump has pushed to curb Chinese influence over the Panama Canal, which carries about 5% of global maritime trade.

headline: Trump Says He’s Set to Announce Fed Pick Friday
summary: President Donald Trump will announce his pick to lead the Federal Reserve Friday morning, he said at the premiere of a documentary featuring his wife, Melania Trump.  The chair nominee will be a “person that won’t be too surprising to people,” Trump said.  Trump has interviewed four candidates for the job.

headline: What are the key challenges awaiting the new US Fed chair?
summary:
US President Donald Trump is set to announce his pick to chair the Federal Reserve on Friday morning, setting up a key shift in the central bank's leadership.- Forging consensus -
Within the bank, the Fed chair is seen to have an outsized influence on forging consensus among the rate-setting Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) as well.

headline: Trump to Announce Fed Chair Pick on Friday
summary: WASHINGTON—President Trump said he would announce his nominee for Federal Reserve chair on Friday morning.  Treasury Secretary  Scott Bessent  has been managing the search and has presented Trump with four finalists:  Kevin Warsh,  a former Fed governor;  Christopher Waller,  a current Fed governor whom Trump appointed to the board in 2020;  Rick Rieder,  a senior executive at  BlackRock  ; and  Kevin Hassett,  the director of the White House National Economic Council.
